bill_title: to provide distinctive motor vehicle license plates for emergency medical technicians.
keywords: Motor Vehicle Registration, License Plates & Fees

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide distinctive motor vehicle license plates for emergency medical technicians. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-5-113 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-113. Any owner of a motor vehicle, who is a resident of this state, who is a firefighter or an EMT as defined by § 13-55-21 and who has complied with all of the laws of this state in relation to the registration of a motor vehicle, may receive plates bearing a distinctive number and design, and designating such person as a firefighter or as an EMT . Such number The distinctive plates for firefighters shall be designed by the fire marshal and the distinctive plates for EMTs shall be designed by the secretary of the Department of Health. The plates are subject to the approval of the Department of Revenue. The distinctive plates shall be in addition to the regular number plates issued for the motor vehicle pursuant to § 32-5-98. The distinctive plates shall be displayed as set forth in § 32-5-98 and the regular number plates shall be kept on or in the motor vehicle. Section 2. That § 32-5-114 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-114. Each person receiving firefighter or EMT distinctive number plates shall pay a fee therefor which shall be fixed by the Department of Revenue so as to reimburse the State of South Dakota for the cost of producing such the special number plates. All fees collected under this section shall be placed in the license plate special revenue fund, as provided under § 32-5-67. Section 3. That § 32-5-116 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-116. Any firefighter or EMT desiring distinctive license plates authorized by § 32-5-113 for use during the next year shall make application to the Department of Revenue specifying the number of vehicles to be licensed, his the applicant's name, and the county of his residence. The department shall notify the manufacturer of the number of special number plates required in sufficient time that such distinctive plates may be produced and sent to the department. Section 4. That § 32-5-117 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-117. Each firefighter or EMT requesting such the special number plates shall be issued a certificate showing his the applicant's county of residence and the number of vehicles upon which such the special plates are to be used. Such The certificate shall bear the signature of the secretary of revenue, and shall be in such form as the Department of Revenue provides. Section 5. That § 32-5-118 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-118. Each firefighter or EMT shall apply to the county treasurer of the county of his the applicant's residence for the issuance of regular number plates for the motor vehicles owned by him the applicant . The firefighter applicant , in order to receive the distinctive plates, shall have paid the fee for the regular number plates and submitted the registration slip for the regular number plates to the Department of Revenue. Section 6. That § 32-5-119 be repealed. 32-5-119. A failure on the part of a firefighter to make application to the Department of Revenue for such special number plates as provided in § 32-5-116 will result in such member being required to accept regular number plates for his motor vehicle. Section 7. That § 32-5-120 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-120. Whenever If any firefighter is discharged, separated , or retires he or any EMT becomes decertified, the person shall surrender the distinctive number plates identifying him the person as a firefighter or an EMT . The distinctive plates shall be surrendered to the secretary of revenue who shall make the necessary changes in his the registration file. The firefighter or EMT shall retain the regular number plates issued under § 32-5-113. Section 8. That § 32-5-121 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-121. If at any time a motor vehicle subject to the distinctive number plates issued for the firefighter shall be or EMT is sold, conveyed, or otherwise transferred by the firefighter to whom such distinctive number plates have been issued, he or EMT, the person shall notify the Department of Revenue. The department of revenue shall process a new registration indicating the motor vehicle to which the distinctive plates are to be transferred. The secretary shall make the necessary changes in the file. The department shall notify the applicant of any corrections which need to be made. The regular number plates shall remain with the motor vehicle to which they were issued. If the motor vehicle to which the distinctive plates are being transferred does not have valid regular number license plates, the firefighter or EMT shall obtain regular number license plates. Section 9. That § 32-5-122 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-122. All statutes of this state relating to the registration of motor vehicles, and the titling and licensing of motor vehicles, the fees for registering, titling and licensing of motor vehicles, and the retention of plates from year to year shall be are applicable to any firefighters fighter or EMT and the distinctive plates issued in conformity with § 32-5-113.
